ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learning more useful Korean grammar, vocab, speech modes, and phrases.
Improved comfortableness with a variety of grammar points, some vocabulary, greater knowledge of Korean culture
We learned more nuanced versions of honorifics, how to talk about intended plans, giving/getting directions, along with the ability to make more complex sentences and thoughts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: very lively classes, well thought out teaching materials (slides, activities, etc)
Weaknesses: Homework was a bit inconsistent

Strengths: Very friendly classroom environment, easy to ask questions, class gets tight knit, lots of opportunities to practice Korean through TA sessions and class. Weaknesses: Probably a hot take but honestly too easy - I had to ask for more homework and honestly given how hard natural Korean is as a language I thought the materials we used were very simple in comparison - low-key wish we used more natural materials / had more homework.
The instructor was very engaging and very good at keeping the course interesting and fresh. The content offered is thorough and actively useful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially with   ! Korean balanced out my schedule and I looked forward to class every day.
If you're interested in continuing Korean, continue taking Korean, especially if it's with Prof Lim! I'd say you can get as much as you put in.
Yes if you want to improve your Korean and enjoy a "speaking first" approach that Prof. Lim has. Very fun time and I became much more comfortable with a number of critical grammar points .
Yes, professor lim is a great instructor
Yes. For any student wishing to continue their study of Korean from previous semesters will not be disappointed by its content.
